title: Does every spiritual person believe in God? - Quora

response.answer_text: that would be a hard NO (one of the only hard No's you find in spiritual people), by God do you mean the Abrahamic God of the Christian, Jewish, and Islamic religions? Or do you mean the gods of the Norse, Egyptian, Asian, or other native people's gods from those who are all powerful to the local gods that protect and guide a special river or grove. Being a spiritual person is by it's nature a personal thing it means different things to different people. But if you had to group them together the biggest spiritualists would be the Buddhists they believe in the balance of all things, their highest most Devine being is just a man who they believe came closest to obtaining true complete balance in peace in himself and with the world around him.

NO. Some believe in weird stuff. So filter everthing through the bible to find out if their beliefs aligned with scriptures , if not then it's another belief system, away from God and the bible, which are both infallible. Meaning no errors in the teachings of God or the bible, but words and grammar may have errors due to human imput in translations.

I guess it all depend on how you define spirituality. Everyone believe in someone or something, or themselves. Some call it “higher power” to be politically correct. People with courage will say “God”

Japan - 126 million people - non deist religion = NO GODS Buddhists - >500 million people - non deist religion = NO GODS yogadancing, listening to musicmindfulnessmeditationexercisemassagemartial artsAny and all of these can lead to a feeling of spirituality, which is essentially a sense of peace and enlightenment, of being in touch with one’s self. No God(s) required.
